definition: row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
formal recommendation letter in eight columns

sentences.english: The demotic scripts and the Semi-cursive script developed in parallel complementarily.
sentences.chinese: 通俗書法類型與行書同步發展，互爲補充。

sentences.english: I write using a word processor.
sentences.chinese: 行書是我國書寫文字的一種方法。

sentences.english: The Zhao Zhiqian running script is the rubbing from a stone inscription union side high achievement.
sentences.chinese: 趙之謙行書是碑帖結合的極高成就。

sentences.english: Portrait of Wang Xizhi, the great Jin calligrapher, famed for his semi-cursive writing.
sentences.chinese: 圖爲最擅長寫行書的晉代大書法家王羲之。

sentences.english: For those who are writing very fast they have semi-cursive and cursive script.
sentences.chinese: 寫得快一些的話，還有行書和草書。

definition: Huang Tingjian (1045-1105), Song poet and calligrapher
Huang Binhong (1865-1955), art historian and literati painter
to write the title of a book on a label
